original: Bergman, Olof, praktiserande läkare, Göteborg, f. 14/1/07 i Gbg av trafikinsp. Gunnar B. o. Anna Anders- son. G. 37 m. Sonja Persson. Barn: Bodil £. 40, Agneta 41, Anders 44. — Stud:ex. i Göteborg 27, med. kand. i Lund 31 o. med. lic. där 37. Kort. förordn. s. e. läk. v. sinnessjukh. samt tf. und :läk. v. barnsjukh., assist :läk. o. tf. und :läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. rönt-gendiagn. avd. 37-38, e. läk. där 39, und :läk. v. örnsköldsviks las. kir. avd. 40-42, v. Vasa sjukh. i Gbg 42-44, prakt. läk. i Gbg sed. 44.
translated: Bergman, Olof, practicing physician, Gothenburg, born on January 14, 1907 in Gothenburg, to traffic inspector Gunnar B. and Anna Andersson. Married in 1937 to Sonja Persson. Children: Bodil born in 1940, Agneta in 1941, and Anders in 1944. Completed secondary school in Gothenburg in 1927, received Bachelor's degree in medicine from Lund University in 1931 and a medical license in 1937. Had brief appointments as assistant physician in psychiatric hospitals and temporary positions as a pediatrician. Worked as assistant physician and temporary junior physician at Sahlgr. Hospital's radiology department from 1937 to 1938, became a physician there in 1939, worked as a junior physician in Örnsköldsvik hospital's surgical department from 1940 to 1942, worked at Vasa hospital in Gothenburg from 1942 to 1944, and has been a practicing physician in Gothenburg since 1944.
